channel.title: Building a PC
channel.description:
Hello! I'm in need of a new pc , my current one is becoming too old to use and , so what i need is just an average computer not too strong or weak. My savings are exactly 340$ , can't afford more. So what build would you guys suggest for an average pc.
Thanks!

item.title: Building a PC
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

The 6300 is comparable to the power of an i5, so why the hell would you buy an i3. Even at the $200 price mark you could get an i5 or you could get an 8350. Depending on what you’re doing, either is a good option. 8350 for rendering any day

Read full topic

item.title: Building a PC
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

6 what? if you meant 4, then lolz there’s a lot more to processors than the number of cores and the clock speed.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a PC
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:7, topic:539583”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=658423.msg4404173#msg4404173 date=1391383522]

[quote author=ixia link=topic=658423.msg4404149#msg4404149 date=1391379254]

If you need something on a budget that wont be used for hardcore gaming, look into the AMD APUs.

What if he decides to upgrade it when he gets more money?

You could get an i5 pretty cheap if you look around online, then go with a budget GPU for the time being.
[/quote]cause amd totally sucks yeah * sarcasm* it’s decent and will get the job done end of/

http://pcpartpicker.com/p/2M9wc

about the best I could do on such a tight budget for you

-dual advantage ram
-500gb hd
-amd fx series ( even if it is the lowest one…it had a 6100 in it originally but we went a little high on the budget doing that… I already had to degrade the memory)

  • i still do not like the psu/ram brands however there wasn’t much I could do considering the prices

please note this is WITHOUT an operating system…but you can…acquire those else where. I feel this should do the basic job for you
[/quote]you do realise that processor is the same price as an i3…? don’t go amd for the sake of a $10 discount ffs[/quote]

You do realize that 6 > 2. imo go i7 or go amd

Read full topic

item.title: Building a PC
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:10, topic:539583”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=658423.msg4404277#msg4404277 date=1391415254]
you do realise that processor is the same price as an i3…? don’t go amd for the sake of a $10 discount ffs
[/quote]if he only has $340 to spend right now that tells me he won’t have $500 to spend later on a good graphics card so it really doesn’t matter I would still stick to AMD.[/quote]
What? I don’t really see what you’re saying. If he chooses AMD for a tiny discount then he needs a different mobo, locking him in to AMD. If he decides later on he wants to upgrade to a better Intel CPU he’d have to buy a new mobo… Unless you have good reason to believe the AMD CPU is better than the Intel CPU and OP is not likely to want to upgrade to Intel in the future, then you shouldn’t be choosing AMD. Not for the sake of a few $$.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a PC
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

Go with a high performance cpu, worry about the graphics later.

Totally forgot about my graphics card in the old one i replaced it a few weeks ago , gt360 2g ddr3 , i won’t just throw that away ;D , So i’m saving a bit here for other parts. Thanks for the suggestions

Read full topic

item.title: Building a PC
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Go with a high performance cpu, worry about the graphics later.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a PC
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“ixia, post:9, topic:539583”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=658423.msg4404151#msg4404151 date=1391380152]

If you need something on a budget that wont be used for hardcore gaming, look into the AMD APUs.

What if he decides to upgrade it when he gets more money?

You could get an i5 pretty cheap if you look around online, then go with a budget GPU for the time being.

You can get a first gen i5 for cheap. Anything worth a damn would be over half of his budget just for the CPU.
[/quote]
No he can get a decent i5 within budget and still be able to get the things he needs. If the OP is taking the harddrive from his old computer, he probably would also be using the same case which effectively saved him quiet a bit of money for other things.[/quote]this is true/something I did not calculate in

[hr]

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:7, topic:539583”]you do realise that processor is the same price as an i3…? don’t go amd for the sake of a $10 discount ffs[/quote]if he only has $340 to spend right now that tells me he won’t have $500 to spend later on a good graphics card so it really doesn’t matter I would still stick to AMD.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a PC
item.dc:creator: @ixia ixia
item.description:
@ixia wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:5, topic:539583”][quote author=ixia link=topic=658423.msg4404149#msg4404149 date=1391379254]

If you need something on a budget that wont be used for hardcore gaming, look into the AMD APUs.

What if he decides to upgrade it when he gets more money?

You could get an i5 pretty cheap if you look around online, then go with a budget GPU for the time being.
[/quote]
You can get a first gen i5 for cheap. Anything worth a damn would be over half of his budget just for the CPU.[/quote]
No he can get a decent i5 within budget and still be able to get the things he needs. If the OP is taking the harddrive from his old computer, he probably would also be using the same case which effectively saved him quiet a bit of money for other things.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a PC
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:6, topic:539583”][quote author=ixia link=topic=658423.msg4404149#msg4404149 date=1391379254]

If you need something on a budget that wont be used for hardcore gaming, look into the AMD APUs.

What if he decides to upgrade it when he gets more money?

You could get an i5 pretty cheap if you look around online, then go with a budget GPU for the time being.
[/quote]cause amd totally sucks yeah * sarcasm* it’s decent and will get the job done end of/

http://pcpartpicker.com/p/2M9wc

about the best I could do on such a tight budget for you

-dual advantage ram
-500gb hd
-amd fx series ( even if it is the lowest one…it had a 6100 in it originally but we went a little high on the budget doing that… I already had to degrade the memory)

  • i still do not like the psu/ram brands however there wasn’t much I could do considering the prices

please note this is WITHOUT an operating system…but you can…acquire those else where. I feel this should do the basic job for you[/quote]

I have a genuine unused windows 8.1 so it’s okay with the operating system and the hard drive i’m willing to take it out of the old one because it was newly replaced , a 1 TB hard disk , and the monitor , keyboard , mouse etc all from the old one

Read full topic

item.title: Building a PC
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

£90 Intel Core i3 3220 Dual Core CPU
£25 Sapphire 11166-02-20R HD 5450 1GB DDR3 PCIE HDMI Graphics Card
£30 Corsair CMZ4GX3M1A1600C9 4GB 1600MHz CL9 DDR3
£45 Corsair Builder Series CXM 500W Modular
£45 WD 1TB Desktop SATA Hard Drive
£30 Any random cool looking case

That ends up being over your budget, but I guess this shit is cheaper in america anyway.

Read full topic
